derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally a noun use in Scots, usually as a little wee 'a little bit'): from Old English wēg(e) (see wey)

entry.tran: 很小的;极小的;一丁点儿的
entry.def: Wee means small in size or extent.

example.ex: I've got a wee kitten in the flat...
example.tran: 我在公寓里养了一只小猫。

example.ex: He just needs to calm down a wee bit.
example.tran: 他只是需要稍微冷静一下。

entry.def: To wee means to urinate. Wee is an informal word used especially by children.

example.ex: He said he wanted to wee.
